meaning: the spirit or identity of a specific time period
example: The zeitgeist of the years preceding the war was a desire for isolation since no one wanted to get involved in an international crisis.

meaning: feeling extremely relaxed
example: peaceful
column4: and free of worries
column5: She turned towards Zen to help her relieve the stress in her life.

meaning: the strongest or most successful period of time
example: Before her zenith ended
column4: Meredith published six best-selling books.

meaning: a light or delicate wind
example: By evening
column4: the harsh wind following the storm had turned into a zephyr that did nothing more than move the leaves.

meaning: a long
example: rigid
column4: German airship that was used during World War I bombings and to transport passengers after the war
column5: As the German airship approached the target
column6: the Zeppelin prepared to use its missile to bomb the area.

meaning: the figure that is written as 0 and represents none
example: 1. The bank claimed that zero dollars were in the man’s account
column4: but he thought he had some money.

meaning: a great amount of enthusiasm
example: Kate's zest for running keeps her very active.

meaning: full of energy and excitement
example: The runners like to enter zestful competitions that will push their energy and make them work for the prize.

meaning: a tower that is tiered and rectangular in shape and occasionally topped by a holy place
example: The shape of the ziggurat is very similar to the shape of a pyramid.

meaning: a line of a “z” pattern in which it crisscrosses back and forth
example: In order to escape the police

meaning: zero or nothing
example: She knew zilch about camping
column4: so when she was asked to help put up the tent she fumbled with poles.

meaning: a surprising or shocking piece of news
example: The writer included a zinger to surprise the reader at the end of the novel.

meaning: a divided band in sky along which the sun

column4: and most of the planets move that is connected to astrology and twelve signs
column5: Twelve cities in the state were named after astrological parts of the zodiac.

meaning: an area or division
example: The zone only has houses and no stores or shops can be built there.

meaning: that portion of science that deals with the analysis of animals and their behaviors
example: Since Chamberlain had a fierce love for animals
column4: choosing zoology as a college major was a natural choice for him.

meaning: to move very quickly
example: The cars began to zoom around the racetrack

meaning: the fertilized egg that results from the union of sex cells
